greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of e.g.f. exp(x/(1 - x)^k).
formula: E.g.f. of column k: exp(x/(1 - x)^k).
Let B(j,k) = (-1)^(j-1)*binomial(-k,j-1) for j>0 and k>=0.
A(0,k) = 1 and A(n,k) = (n-1)! * Sum_{j=1..n} j*B(j,k)*A(n-j,k)/(n-j)! for n > 0. (End)
mathematica: Table[Function[k, n! SeriesCoefficient[Exp[x/(1 - x)^k], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 10}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 28 2017
